gov.usgs.anss.util

Class PNZOld

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.PNZOld

  • public class PNZOld
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent a Poles and Zeros as commonly used in seismology. When used with RESP files for SEED usage a0 is normally that defined in the SEED manual. WHen this is used to respresent a "cooked" response it is the gain value (sensitivity) in units like counts/nm.

      Creates a new instance of PNZOld from text in resp form or text from stasrv form

      • getResponse

        public Complex getResponse(double f)
        return the response value as a complex. A0 is the scale factor to multiply the ratio of the products of the zeros/poles.
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles)

      • getAmp

        public double getAmp(double f)
        return the amplitude portion of the response at given frequency
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response modulus(a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))

      • getPhase

        public double getPhase(double f)
        return the phase portion of the response at given frequency in degreens
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response atax2(imag(resp)/real(resp)) converted to degrees

      • getA0

        public double getA0(double f)
        Calculate the value of a0 as presented by SEED from the poles and zeros. That is 1./modulus(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        a0 value per seed =1./modulus(a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))

      • getA0Phase

        public double getA0Phase(double f)
        Calculate the value phase in degrees as presented by SEED from the poles and zeros. That is ans=(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles)), return is atan2(imag(ans), real(ans) in degrees.
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        phase(a0) value per seed atan2(imag(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles),real(...)))
